title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chicken marinated in spices, grilled, and served in a rich tomato-based curry sauce.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, and cumin powder for 1 hour.
Grill chicken until cooked through and slightly charred.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onion until golden brown.
Add tomato puree, cream, and cooked chicken. Simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

title: Pad Thai
description: Stir-fried rice noodles with shrimp, tofu, bean sprouts, and peanuts in a tangy tamarind sauce.
ingredients: Fresh cilantro and lime wedges for garnish
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, soy sauce, and palm sugar.
Heat oil in a wok or large pan. Add garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add shrimp and tofu, stir-fry until shrimp turns pink.
Push ingredients to the side and pour beaten eggs into the pan. Scramble until cooked.
Add noodles and tamarind sauce mixture. Toss to combine thoroughly.
Stir in bean sprouts and half of the chopped peanuts.
Serve hot, garnished with remaining peanuts, cilantro, and lime wedges.

reviews.comment: Perfect Pad Thai! Better than restaurant.
Delicious, but a bit sweet for my taste.

title: Chili Chicken
description: Crispy chicken tossed in a spicy and tangy sauce with bell peppers and onions.
instructions: In a bowl, marinate chicken with soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, vinegar, and red chili powder.
Coat marinated chicken pieces with cornstarch.
Heat oil in a pan. Fry chicken until crispy and golden brown. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, sauté bell pepper, onion, and green chilies until tender-crisp.
Add fried chicken pieces and toss with the vegetables.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

title: Paneer Butter Masala
description: Soft paneer cubes cooked in a creamy and aromatic tomato-based sauce.
instructions: Heat butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds and sauté until they splutter.
Add chopped onion and ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until onion turns golden brown.
Add tomato puree, garam masala, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and kasuri methi. Cook until oil separates.
Stir in cream and cook for a few minutes.
Add paneer cubes and simmer for 5-10 minutes until paneer is heated through and sauce thickens.
Garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with naan or rice.

reviews.comment: Best Paneer Butter Masala I've ever had!
Creamy and flavorful, loved every bite.
